The keys of the transpositions consist of characters of the specified alphabet.

The read-in and -out methods (column-wise and row-wise) are explained in the following articles.

context.title: Transposition
context.description:
The transposition cipher relocates the letters of the plaintext based on an order generated from the keyword.
Transposition ciphers are one of the oldest cryptographic algorithms. A well-known example is the Scytale, which was documented first in the Pelleponesian war, 431 BC.
